title: IAG sells Indian insurance interest for $640m
text:
Insurance Australia Group has agreed to sell its 26 per cent interest in SBI General Insurance Company for a total of $640 million, in a deal that will boost its 2020 profit by $300 million.

Napean Opportunities LLP, part of Premji Invest, the family office of Indian billionaire businessman Azim Premji, will buy 16.01 per cent of the SBI General.

IAG CEO Peter Harmer: "Now is the right time for IAG to exit its investment in SBI General". Louie Douvis

An affiliate of US private equity firm Warburg Pincus LLC will acquire the remaining 9.99 per cent of the company.

SBI General began life in 2010 as a joint venture between the Australian insurer and the State Bank of India. It offers general and health insurance.

The $640 million price tag, on current exchange rates, represents a more than fivefold return on IAG's initial investment of $126 million. The transaction is expected to complete before the end of the 2020 financial year.
description: Insurance Australia Group has sold its 26 per cent interest in SBI General, in a deal that will boost its 2020 profit by $300 million.
